# std_types::window_manager/std::create_window (a method)

  creates a new window

  Parameters:
    window_manager: the window manager
    options*: how to create the new window

  Result:
    window_manager: the updated window manager
    window_id: the id of the new window (if requested)

  Creates a new window with the specified options.

  The options can be:

  * ID: the id of the window (default: auto-generated)
  * USE_CURSOR: whether to use a cursor (default: false)
  * AS_FIRST: whether to place the window at the beginning of the list
    (default: false)
  * DO_NOT_FOCUS: whether to not focus the window (default: false)
  * TITLE: the title of the window (default: "<untitled>")
  * CONTENT: the content of the window
  * CLEAR_COLOUR: the background color (default: WHITE)
  * HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR: whether to show a horizontal scrollbar
    (default: true)
  * VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR: whether to show a vertical scrollbar
    (default: true)
  * BUTTONS: additional buttons (default: empty list)
  * SIZE: the size of the window (default: DEFAULT)
  * CURSOR_X: the initial x position of the cursor (default: 1)
  * CURSOR_Y: the initial y position of the cursor (default: 1)
  * FIRST_VISIBLE_COLUMN: the first visible column (default: 1)
  * FIRST_VISIBLE_ROW: the first visible row (default: 1)
  * MODAL: whether the window is modal (default: false)
  * PARENT_ID: the id of the parent window (default: undefined)

  If the *AS_FIRST* option is set, the new window is placed at the beginning
  of the window list.

  If the *DO_NOT_FOCUS* option is set, the new window is not focused.

  If the *SIZE* option is set to MAXIMIZED, the window is maximized.

  Topic: Window Manager

  See also: std_types::window_manager/std::create_dialog,
	    std_types::window_manager/std::set_title,
	    std_types::window_manager/std::set_content

  Example:

    $window_manager create_window_manager(terminal)
    create_window &window_manager $window_id
      TITLE = "My Window"
      USE_CURSOR

((defined in terminal/window_manager.fky))
